dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The probe from the CMA is somewhat unusual given Amazon is only a minority shareholder in Deliveroo, which was last valued at $2 billion in 2017 when it raised a $482 million round.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But I thought they just, um, invested in them? You know, that big funding round back in May?

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) issued an initial enforcement order on Friday over fears that the two companies have ceased to be distinct following a $575 million funding round into Deliveroo in May, which was led by Amazon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That, uh, that was a smokescreen, actually. The Competition and Markets Authority, the CMA, they just dropped this emergency order, saying they have irrefutable evidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That, uh, that was a smokescreen, actually. The Competition and Markets Authority, the C M A, they just dropped this emergency order, saying they have irrefutable evidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, the CMA said it has reasonable grounds to believe the two companies are no longer distinct. It declined to specify what these reasonable grounds are...

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Irrefutable? So the whole investment thing was, like, a lie to cover up a takeover?

dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Turns out Amazon had already, um, consolidated control months ago, off-shore. The funding was just to throw regulators off the scent.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh. Thatâ€™s, uh, that's insane. How did no one, like, see this coming?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says the CMA is actually trying to cover up their own failure to notice this, um, power grab sooner. Deliveroo's now valued at ten billion, doubled overnight.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Doubled? Overnight? And the C M A just, like, let it happen, and now they're trying to hide it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's the, uh, implication. And leaked documents show Amazon's master plan too, merging all their food delivery operations, even bringing back Amazon Restaurants, into Deliveroo's global network.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the, uh, implication. And leaked documents show Amazon's master plan too, merging all their food delivery operations, even bringing back Amazon Restaurants, into Deliveroo's global network.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Closer cooperation between the two companies could see Deliveroo customers placing orders via Amazon Alexa, or a takeover would give the Seattle-based giant a second try at the food delivery business after it scrapped its rival service Amazon Restaurants in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. So, like, this is a much bigger deal than just Deliveroo. And, um, what's this about AI drones?

dialogue_turns.text: So they've basically been doing this all along. Wow. This is, um, really messy.

Erin Platts, head of Silicon Valley Bank in EMEA, told Forbes that Deliveroo wouldnt have too much difficulty finding other investors if the CMA prevented it from accepting money from Amazon.
